title: Errors with MySQL database - Version Testing
author: VQFCOSTA-Infortech
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
-
I communicate with the MySQL database, but I cannot import the xml file that I currently use for the database, when trying to import both csv and xml, the import presents an error.
-

![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/140181514/eb2f9824-ade6-4662-b399-06d90bd26130)

![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/140181514/72786e2f-4e5a-4442-b051-9dac5c686610)

The other problem I have is w...

comments.snippet:
Another detail presented in this ticket is also a problem I have, every time I open mRemoteNG, I have to access the options and define the sql server so that it can query the database, because every time I open it, it starts in the conf file. default xml

https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2498
comments.author: VQFCOSTA-Infortech

comments.snippet: I think the schema needs to be updated, Im looking for the latest version of the create script too.  I can't seem to find it.
comments.author: deanoblock

comments.snippet:
Is there an amount I have to donate to be able to run this version with the mysql db schema working?

If so, if you define a value with the affirmation that you will put it to work, even if just for my scenario, and it is viable, we can make the donation to pay for the focus time you will give on this task.

I don't want you to misunderstand me, but I have a project to use mRemoteNG throughout the company, but I need this synchronization with the database so that everyone shares the same inf...
comments.author: VQFCOSTA-Infortech

comments.snippet: hello its not question of payment actualy, its question of knowledge, I am not expert in mySQL (Oracle yes!) they have similarityes but still looking into (and its a high presure for new release so working on that bit as well) so be patient its definitely something related to schema I already setup db so trying to figurout what its not happy with
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Seems there's a difference between the embedded ones and the one on develop branch.
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/develop/mRemoteNGDocumentation/mysql_db_setup.sql
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/develop/mRemoteNGDocumentation/mssql_db_setup.sql

I need to dig a little bit after 1.77.1.27654 to get the schema. Brb
comments.author: savornicesei

comments.snippet:
@VQFCOSTA-Infortech 

The 1.77.1 version available for download is 1.77.1.27713. while yours is 1.77.1.27654. 
Do you get the same errors with the official 1.77.1.27713 one?

L.E. I tested the portable 1.77.1.27713 version with MariaDB 10.4.24 (from a XAMPP installation I have) using [this script](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/blob/v1.77.1/mRemoteV1/Documentation/mysql_db_setup.sql) to create the DB. I was able to import a RDP connection and create new containers and connections.
comments.author: savornicesei

I was using MSI, I'm going to switch to portable and do the tests with the script you gave me.

comments.snippet:
Good news, I restarted the bank and it works!!

Now I need to import my XML that I cried all these months, but it's not working, it's giving me an error when importing.

Source version
1.76.20.24669

Current version:
1.77.1.27713

![image](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/assets/140181514/8d3f4c68-2610-4a68-8927-d6d361e6340c)
comments.author: VQFCOSTA-Infortech

comments.snippet:
Importing the data via CSV was successful.
Problems resolved, thank you very much to everyone involved, I await updates, I wish only success to everyone involved in the development of mRemoteNG and I want to help in any way I can.
See you later and thank you.
comments.author: VQFCOSTA-Infortech

comments.snippet:

Just curious - did you export as xml from mRemoteNG v1.76.20 and tried to import it in 1.77.1 and it failed?
Thanks,
Simo

comments.snippet: we have new guy who said he is good on db, let him finish celebrating and let see what we could do about it, on first look seems something got deleted, do you have backup of you db?
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet:
Yes, I make a backup daily, but I checked the DB backup and there was no backup of the connections registered in the database, only the tables...

Part of the script below

---
db_user="root"
db_name="mRemoteNG"
backup_dir="/mremoteng/db"

Backup file name with data and current time
backup_file="$backup_dir/backup_mremoteng_$(date +'%Y.%m.%d_%H:%M').sql.gz"
mysqldump -u "$db_user" "$db_name" -x -e | gzip > "$backup_file"

---

[backups.zip](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/f...

comments.snippet:
Triage refresh (P4 version-label debt): this issue is tagged with legacy version labels. Please retest on the latest build (fork v1.79.x or upstream dev), then share reproducible steps and expected vs actual behavior. If still valid, keep open and relabel to current triage scope (for example Need 2 check). If fixed, close with resolution.

Current legacy version labels: 1.77.3
